intro: Cardanthera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Cardanthera parviflora is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, desert scrub, and along coastal dunes.
